author: superfreek
content: theres support for ExamplePairings, which couples example payloads/responses, populates the 'try it now' when available, heres an example: https://playground.open-rpc.org/?url=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/open-rpc/examples/master/service-descriptions/api-with-examples-openrpc.json

author: bayesianmind
content: I'm looking to learn about available tooling - I'd like to extract data from the chain, for example to plot the total supply of an ERC-20 token over time. My best idea currently is to programatically fork a ganache client forked to successively later blocks, call totalSupply() on the token, and iterate. Any other recommended ways to look into doing this?

author: superfreek
content:
core-geth does something similar to 1474, generates markdown out of an openrpc document to produce this site via mkdocs: https://etclabscore.github.io/core-geth/JSON-RPC-API/modules/eth/

I believe its a custom markdown generator though, I think the code is here: https://github.com/etclabscore/core-geth/blob/e9b5f6068ebfa4445fa66ad126d29b5ae9adaebb/ethclient/docsgen_test.go
